Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rule
  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents all 256 rules by which an Elementary Cellular Automata (ECA) will evolve.
    Author:
    Devin McAfee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String rule
      The binary string equivalent of any number between 1 and 256 representing any one of the rules which can govern an ECA's evolution.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Rule()
      Default constructor initializing the rule field to null.
      Rule​(int ruleNum)
      Constructor initializing the rule field by converting a given int value into a binary string using the toBinaryString() method of the Integer class and padding the resulting string with leading 0s until it is 8 characters in length.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getRule()
      Gets a copy of the rule field.
      void setRule​(int ruleNum)
      Uses the same logic as the primary constructor to initialize the rule field using a given ruleNum.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • rule

        private java.lang.String rule
        The binary string equivalent of any number between 1 and 256 representing any one of the rules which can govern an ECA's evolution.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule​(int ruleNum)
        Constructor initializing the rule field by converting a given int value into a binary string using the toBinaryString() method of the Integer class and padding the resulting string with leading 0s until it is 8 characters in length. 8 is the desired length of the rule string because there are 8 possible combinations of three neighboring cells in an ECA.
        Parameters:
        ruleNum - an int representing the base 10 equivalent of the rule field.

      • Rule

        public Rule()
        Default constructor initializing the rule field to null. This constructor should only be used in conjunction with the setRule() method.

    • Method Detail

      • getRule

        public java.lang.String getRule()
        Gets a copy of the rule field.
        Returns:
        a string representing a copy of the rule field.

      • setRule

        public void setRule​(int ruleNum)
        Uses the same logic as the primary constructor to initialize the rule field using a given ruleNum.
        Parameters:
        ruleNum - an int representing the base 10 equivalent of the rule field.
